sect1.title: Changelog
sect1.para: This is version &version; of the Linux From Scratch book, dated &releasedate;. If this book is more than six months old, a newer and better version is probably already available. To find out, please check one of the mirrors via .
Below is a list of changes made since the previous release of the book.

listitem.para: [jhuntwork] - Use --with-arch=i486 only for x86. Also force '-m64' for 64-bit builds. Lastly, use 'make' instead of 'make bootstrap' on gcc pass 1. The bootstrap is now default.
[bdubbs] - Upgrade to Linux-2.6.22.5. Fixes #2065.
[dnicholson] - Changed the Shadow download URL to a more stable location.
[bdubbs] - Synced to 6.3 updates: linux 2.6.22.4, man-db patch, update acknowledgements page.
[jhuntwork] - Use --with-arch=i486 on GCC instead of -march=i486 with Glibc.
[bryan] - Fix typo in acknowledgements.
[bdubbs] - Upgrade to Linux-2.6.22.3, fixes #2060..
[bdubbs] - Updated acknowledgements.
[dnicholson] - Updated to LFS-Bootscripts-20070813.
[bdubbs] - Upgrade to Linux-2.6.22.2, fixes #2059.
[dnicholson] - Changed the Bash testsuite standard input fix to only affect the necessary test script.
[jhuntwork] - Add -march=i486 to Glibc for x86 builds as default of i386 is incompatible.
[jhuntwork] - Make the sed to Glibc's test-installation.pl file architecture independent.
[jhuntwork] - Fix Perl-5.8.8 to build with GCC-4.2.1. Have makedepend.SH check for 'command-line' as well as 'command line'.
[jhuntwork] - Fix Coreutils-6.9 and Gzip-1.3.12 to work with Glibc-2.6.1. Rename the futimens function.
[jhuntwork] - Use a loop, find and sed instead of the gcc specs patch
[jhuntwork] - Upgraded to Glibc 2.6.1
[jhuntwork] - Add --disable-shared to gcc pass 1. Requires adding a libgcc_eh.a -> libgcc.a symlink.
[jhuntwork] - Since we're using HJL Binutils, add m4, bison and flex back to chatper 5.
[jhuntwork] - Upgraded to GCC 4.2.1
[jhuntwork] - Upgraded to HJL Binutils-2.17.50.0.18
[jhuntwork] - Update commands to work with both x86 and x86_64

[jhuntwork] - Use '-n' when creating /tools/lib64 symlink. Will fail if that directory or symlink already exists, instead of creating an unwanted lib -> lib symlink inside of /tools/lib. Fix from Dan Nicholson.
